Description: Pottery bowl of Nile silt, coated with red slip on the interior and exterior. The interior is burnished horizontally at the base, and vertically up the sides. The exterior is burnished only around the rim. The bowl is deformed; the orifice is not round.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna (London, 1911), p. 17; pl. xxxi. 22a; reproduced as Polished red P22A in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery.
